Dear Dave

I would certainly support a workshop in connection to the upcomi=
ng
combustion symposium, and I assume that it will attract more European
pa=
rticipants than the workshop in Chicago, simply because of the
location. If=
 you need help to arrange the workshop I am willing to
contribute...

Best =
regards,
Martin


--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c=
...> wrote:
>
> At the first Cantera workshop in Chicago in 2004, we said s=
omething 
> about holding another one in conjunction with the Combustion Sy=
mposium 
> in Heidelberg in 2006.  Now we need to decide whether to do it o=
r not.  
> I'd like to get some sense of how useful people feel a Cantera w=
orkshop 
> would be, and how many might attend if it were held in Heidelber=
g on 
> Sunday, August 6.
> 
> If we do it, I would like much of the worksh=
op to consist of 
> contributed talks from Cantera users on what you are do=
ing with Cantera 
> in research or teaching.  But of course I could talk ab=
out future 
> directions for Cantera (or whatever else people are intereste=
d in) too.
> 
> Another option would be to hold a workshop somewhere else. =
 This might 
> be preferred by non-combustion Cantera users, who wouldn't b=
e in 
> Heidelberg. (There's always the "Westin La Cantera" golf resort nea=
r 
> San Antonio, Texas...)
> 
> Let me know what you think, either by post=
ing to the user's group, or 
> by sending me an email message.
> 
> Thanks,=

> Dave
>
